physical_appearance:This watch belonging to Justice Choor Singh is irregular in shape and is silver in colour. Citizen is the brand manufacturer of this watch. The words \u0027CITIZEN AUTOMATIC\u0027 can be seen at the top of the watch\u0027s quadrant while the word \u002721JEWELS\u0027 can be seen at the bottom. \u0027LON 22\u0027 is displayed at the right hand side of the watch\u0027s quadrant
subject_terms_1:judges
subject_terms_2:Judges
subject_terms_3:Pioneers
sgcool_label_text:Citizen brand watch
 worn by Justice Choor Singh. Choor Singh was the first Indian to hold the position of Magistrate in Colonial Malaya
 and was appointed as a judge of the Supreme Court of Singapore in 1963. Apart from an illustrious legal career
 he made significant contributions to the Sikh community in Singapore. He was one of the founders of the Singapore Khalsa Association
 and advocated the teaching of Punjabi in Singapore as the Chairman of the Sikh Advisory Board. He also authored several books on the Sikh religion and the Sikh community in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This watch belonging to Justice Choor Singh is irregular in shape and is silver in colour. Citizen is the brand manufacturer of this watch. The words 'CITIZEN AUTOMATIC' can be seen at the top of the watch's quadrant while the word '21JEWELS' can be seen at the bottom. 'LON 22' is displayed at the right hand side of the watch's quadrant
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Citizen brand watch, worn by Justice Choor Singh. Choor Singh was the first Indian to hold the position of Magistrate in Colonial Malaya, and was appointed as a judge of the Supreme Court of Singapore in 1963. Apart from an illustrious legal career, he made significant contributions to the Sikh community in Singapore. He was one of the founders of the Singapore Khalsa Association, and advocated the teaching of Punjabi in Singapore as the Chairman of the Sikh Advisory Board. He also authored several books on the Sikh religion and the Sikh community in Singapore.
